intro: Moniera subserrata, commonly known as the serrated moniera, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Monimiaceae. It is characterized by its evergreen nature and distinctive leaves that are serrated along the margins. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded forest environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, often with a fragrant scent that attracts pollinators. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its propagation in natural habitats.
